INTERNATIONAL A3-15 Six black rail workers were killed and four police officers were seriously wounded in two clashes in South Africa, and 16,000 workers were dismissed for ignoring a deadline to end a strike. A1 Sri Lanka attacked bases of two Tamil guerrilla separatist groups in the north, killing 80 people, in reprisal for two terrorist bombings that killed at least 237 people. A14 An ex-CIA official is a principal in the criminal investigation of the Iran-contra affair, the special prosecutor said. The former official, Thomas Clines, worked with Lieut. Col. Oliver L. North. A10 Iran has sentenced a U.S. engineer, Jon Pattis, to 10 years in prison, saying he had spied for the Central Intelligence Agency, Teheran officials announced. A11 Moscow's latest offer on short-range arms was criticized by a senior Washington official, Kenneth L. Adelman. He said the Kremlin had retreated from positions outlined in Moscow to Secretary of State George P. Shultz. A6 Washington can neutralize any electronic listening devices that might have been placed in the new United States Embassy in Moscow, according to Robert Lamb, the State Department's top security official. A7 Canadians deplore acid rain, which originates from smokestacks in the Ohio Valley and moves northeast to Ontario, where it kills fish and pushes entire lakes toward biological death. A1 Pessimism over Star Wars has reportedly been expressed by key physicists. They said so many breakthroughs are required that it will take a decade or more to determine whether the program can be carried out. A1 The bond market is suffering its worst beating in nearly three years as thousands of investors are selling their holdings out of fear that the plummeting dollar will revive inflation. A1 107,000 schools would be inspected for asbestos, and administrators would be required to remove the carcinogen under new rules proposed by the Environmental Protection Agency. The panel deliberated only two days in the five-month trial of Mr. Hunt, the leader of a group called the Billionaire Boys Club. A16 The N.B.A. is expanding by four franchises. The owners of the 23 existing teams unexpectedly voted unanimously to award franchises to two Florida cities, Miami and Orlando, as well as to Charlotte, N.C., and Minneapolis. A1 Welfare payments could be halted to a family that received a lump-sum personal injury award, the Supreme Court ruled. The 5-4 decision involves a major Federal-state welfare program, Aid to Families with Dependant Children. B11 The elderly fared far better than all other American population groups in their income gains in the first half of the 1980's, according to an analysis of Census Bureau statistics.
